content:
StringType Class

Definition

This class has been deprecated as of Visual Basic 2005.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.EditorBrowsable(System.ComponentModel.EditorBrowsableState.Never)]
public sealed class StringType
Inheritance
Object
StringType
Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
ToString()

Remarks

This class provides methods for manipulating data that potentially represents a String value.

Methods

FromBoolean(Boolean)

Returns a String value that corresponds to the specified Boolean.

public static string FromBoolean (bool Value);
Parameters
Value
Boolean

Required. Boolean to convert to a String value.

Returns
String

The String value corresponding to Value.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

This class supports the Visual Basic compiler and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

MidStmtStr(String, Int32, Int32, String)

Overwrites the sDest parameter with the contents of the sInsert parameter.

public static void MidStmtStr (ref string sDest, int StartPosition, int MaxInsertLength, string sInsert);
Parameters
sDest
String

Required. String variable to modify.

StartPosition
Int32

Required. Location in the sDest parameter to begin overwriting from. The index is 1-based.

MaxInsertLength
Int32

Required. Maximum number of characters from the sInsert parameter to use, starting from the first character.

sInsert
String

Required. String value to overwrite the sDest parameter with.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

This class supports the Visual Basic compiler and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

StrCmp(String, String, Boolean)

Compares two strings.

public static int StrCmp (string sLeft, string sRight, bool TextCompare);
Parameters
sLeft
String

Required. String to compare with sRight.

sRight
String

Required. String to compare with sLeft.

TextCompare
Boolean

Required. True to perform a case-insensitive comparison; otherwise False.

Returns
Int32
Value
 Condition
zero
 The two strings are equal.
less than zero
 sLeft is less than sRight.
greater than zero
 sLeft is greater than sRight.
Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

This class supports the Visual Basic compiler and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

StrLike(String, String, CompareMethod)

Compares the parameters Source and Pattern and returns the same results as the Like operator.

public static bool StrLike (string Source, string Pattern, Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompareMethod CompareOption);
Parameters
Source
String

Required. Any String expression.

Pattern
String

Any String expression conforming to the pattern-matching conventions described in Like Operator.

CompareOption
CompareMethod

Specifies how to compare strings to patterns, according to the CompareMethod. Can be vbBinaryCompare for binary comparison or vbTextCompare for comparison based on a case-insensitive text sort order determined by your system's LocaleID value.

Returns
Boolean

A Boolean value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern. If the value in string satisfies the pattern contained in pattern, result is True. If the string does not satisfy the pattern, result is False. If both string and pattern are empty strings, the result is True.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

This method compares the parameters Source and Pattern and returns the same results as the Like Operator. The result is a Boolean value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern.

StrLikeBinary(String, String)

Compares the parameters Source and Pattern and returns the same results as the Like operator, using binary comparison.

public static bool StrLikeBinary (string Source, string Pattern);
Parameters
Source
String

Required. Any String expression.

Pattern
String

Required. Any String expression conforming to the pattern-matching conventions described in Like Operator.

Returns
Boolean

A Boolean value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern. If the value in string satisfies the pattern contained in pattern, result is True. If the string does not satisfy the pattern, result is False. If both string and pattern are empty strings, the result is True.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

This method compares the parameters Source and Pattern and returns the same results as the Like Operator. The result is a Boolean value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern.

This method is similar to StrLike except that it always performs a case-sensitive binary comparison.

StrLikeText(String, String)

Compares the parameters Source and Pattern and returns the same results as the Like operator, using text comparison.

public static bool StrLikeText (string Source, string Pattern);
Parameters
Source
String

Required. Any String expression.

Pattern
String

Required. Any String expression conforming to the pattern-matching conventions described in Like Operator.

Returns
Boolean

A Boolean value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern. If the value in string satisfies the pattern contained in pattern, result is True. If the string does not satisfy the pattern, result is False. If both string and pattern are empty strings, the result is True.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

This method compares the parameters Source and Pattern and returns the same results as the Like Operator. The result is a Boolean value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern.

This method is similar to StrLike except that it always performs a comparison based on a case-insensitive text sort order determined by your system's LocaleID value.
